item.title: A Personal Corner of the Internet
item.description: I’ve been feeling like I don’t have a place on the internet anymore. It’s become a mall, homogenized by the Facebooks, Instagrams, Twitters, and YouTubes. Everything has a similar aesthetic. Everything is geared towards likes and follows. I miss the land of Geocities, and Xanga, and even MySpace, where pockets of the internet were weirder and more individualized. We weren’t so focused on building audiences or brands; we just made things because it was kind of amazing that we had this new canvas for expression.
